title.native: 劇場版プリパラ　み～んなあつまれ！プリズム☆ツアーズ

description:
PriPara Movie: Minna Atsumare! Prism☆Tours is the film based on and starring the characters from PriPara. The film first began showing in theaters across Japan from March 7th, 2015. The plot focuses on Laala Manaka finding out about Saints' top idol journey, and aside from the PriPara performances, the movie also features the journey of characters across all the Pretty Rhythm series. At some point in the movie, the characters are given a choice of four doors to go through. At this point, the movie diverges into one of 4 routes depending on what the audience chooses. Each route recaps different aspects of the previous Pretty Rhythm series, mainly reintroducing the different characters and their performances. However, Laala and friends only get a chance to enter one door at a time, meaning the film must be watched four times to view each door choice.

(Sources: PriPara Wikia and Wikipedia)
synonyms: PriPara the Movie: Everyone, Assemble! Prism ☆ Tours

tags.name: Crossover
tags.description: Centers around the placement of two or more otherwise discrete fictional characters, settings, or universes into the context of a single story.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/iyaiyaenn/)

She started working as animator for [Shin-Ei Douga](https://anilist.co/studio/247/ShinEi-Animation), where she later debuted as assistant episode director on [Yakyuukyou no Uta](https://anilist.co/anime/10554//) and [Ikkyuu-san](https://anilist.co/anime/4935/) before she became storyboarder and then episode director on the [Doraemon](https://anilist.co/anime/2471/Doraemon-1979/) television series. In 1982, when another former Shin-ei director, [Fukutomi Hiroshi](https://anilist.co/staff/105280/Hiroshi-Fukutomi), established [Animaru-Ya](https://anilist.co/studio/386/Animaruya) she was one of the founding members together with Sanada Yoshinobu and [Honda Toshiyuki](https://anilist.co/staff/129528/Toshiyuki--Honda). She stayed at Animaru-Ya, which is presently known as [Ekura Animaru](https://anilist.co/studio/6257/Ekura-Animal), until 2004 before leaving to work as freelancer.

(Source: aniDB)

name.native: 株式会社シンソフィア

node.description:
__Associated Names:__ Poyoyon Rock (ぽよよんろっく), Poyoyon♥Rock (ぽよよん♥ろっく), Pucchin Purin

[Twitter (NSFW)](https://twitter.com/punipoyo)

A Japanese animator, character designer, and animation director currently living in Tokyo, Japan. He often goes by the pseudonym Poyoyon Rock.  He is also a member of the doujinshi circle Pokopii.  

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Doujin Circles:__ UB, Vachicalist

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/okamarble)

A guy who chooses to only play female characters in games. Since he is called Okama (cross-dresser) after all.

__[Website](http://www.spacecraft.co.jp/saito/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/斉藤恒芳)__

__Tsuneyoshi Saito__ is a Japanese composer and arranger. He has composed for several anime series, films, and TV dramas.

Originating from [Studio Live](https://anilist.co/studio/6460/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [other animator](https://anilist.co/staff/133010/)._
